definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: The week began with forecasts of huge public-sector job losses.
sentences.chinese: 這個禮拜一開始就有傳言，說要大量裁員。

sentences.english: She is going to Shanghai next Monday.
I felt terrible on Monday and worse on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 禮拜一我感覺很糟糕，禮拜二更差。

sentences.english: Your Labor Day is on the first Monday of September, right?
sentences.chinese: 九月的第一個禮拜一是你們的勞動節是嗎？

sentences.english: Monday comes, and the four nuns return.
sentences.chinese: 禮拜一，四個修女都回來了。

sentences.english: The results of the test will be posted next Monda.
sentences.chinese: 下禮拜一將公佈測試結果。

sentences.english: He said the bank would close soon and would not open again until Monday.
sentences.chinese: 他說銀行很快就要關門，直到禮拜一將才會開門。

sentences.english: His last run, he said, was Monday.
sentences.chinese: 他說禮拜一是他最後一次出海。

sentences.english: Where will they be next Monday?
sentences.chinese: 下禮拜一他們會在哪裏？

sentences.english: Could you let me have the Bonus provision by Monday before noon.
sentences.chinese: 請您在禮拜一中午前把獎金預提提供給我。

sentences.english: The interview with President Yar'Adua was recorded late on Monday and first broadcast at 0530 GMT on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 總統凡人發言是在禮拜一錄的，首次播出是在禮拜二。

definition: matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
(of the sun) to scorch/to expose to a scorching sun
to go to some place at night/to take a night trip to (a place)/to sleepwalk
